title: Real-Life-Based Probability Learning: Intermediate Course Utilizing Mobile Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic arithmetic operations and data interpretation
context.additional_context: Project-based assessment applying probability concepts to daily life through language learning integration

learning_goals: Learners can accurately describe probability problems in mathematical language using real-life scenarios (e.g., weather forecasting, sports outcomes).
Learners can create probability distribution charts using mobile tools and collaboratively analyze results with team members.
Learners can calculate theoretical probability values based on experimental data with over 80% accuracy.

resources: Simple IoT Device for Daily Data Collection (Optional)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
